response:
The patient presents with unilateral visual impairment (smudge sensation, reduced acuity 6/18) and a Relative Afferent Pupillary Defect (RAPD) on the left. This classically localises to a lesion of the Left Optic Nerve (optic neuritis). The mild, patchy upper limb weakness (Right elbow flexion 4+/5, Left wrist extension 4+/5) is asymmetric and unaccompanied by reflex changes or sensory loss; while this could represent subtle multifocal CNS demyelination (dissemination in space), the definitive and localising lesion is the optic nerve.
